Patent Information.Abstract: Antimicrobial peptides (endobiotic peptides), isolated from fish are described. Such endobiotic peptides may be isolated as 22 amino acid peptides having molecular weights of about 2500 Da from the gills of hybrid striped bass (Morone saxitilis×Morone chrysops). Antibodies that bind such peptides and methods of using such peptides are also described.

Sequence Information.Source: Morone chrysops x Morone saxatilis (white bass x striped sea-bass)
Sequence Information.Target Organism: [Swiss_Prot Entry P0C006]broad-spectrum antimicrobial activity against both Gram-positive and Gram-negative bacteria
Sequence Information.Hemolytic Activity: [Ref.11713517]5% hemolytic activity at 100 μg/mL against human erythrocytes
Sequence Information.Function: Exhibits broad-spectrum antimicrobial activity against both Gram-positive and Gram-negative bacteria. Has hemolytic activity.
Sequence Information.Tissue specificity: Mast cells in gill, skin and gut, and in lining blood vessels in the viscera.

Literature.Title: Peptide antibiotics in mast cells of fish.
Literature.Author: Silphaduang U, Noga EJ.
